PROXY-WAR.Definition: a war fought between smaller groups on behalf of larger groups

NICHE.Definition: very specific and only interesting to a small group of people

EXPANSE.Definition: a large open stretch of land

BUFFER.Definition: something that protects another thing from something else

ALLEGIANCES.Definition: loyalties and beliefs (especially to a country or leader)

FOOTHOLD.Definition: a position from which you can make progress

WITH OPEN ARMS.Definition: in a friendly and welcoming way

BASE.Definition: the main place from where an army or organisation controls their activities

DISGUISE.Definition: something you wear to change your appearance and make yourself look like someone else

PUPPET.Definition: a person who is controlled by someone else

EXILE.Definition: sent away from your own country

UPRISING.Definition: when the people of a place rise up against those people in power

OFFENCE.Definition: behaviour that makes someone angry or upset

MOBS.Definition: large groups of crowds, especially violent ones

DOWNFALL.Definition: the end of a person or organisation

COMPOUND.Definition: a residential area surrounded by a wall, often used for the military

CHARM.Definition: being easily able to attract others

BLINDFOLD.Definition: a piece of cloth that covers your eyes

FACTIONS.Definition: groups (normally within a larger groups), typically with different characteristics or views

WHETTED YOUR APPETITE.Definition: makes you want to do something again (or in greater detail)
